alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:28PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marshall County through 400 PM CDT... At 328 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Red Banks, or 7 miles west of Holly Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holly Springs, Wall Doxey State Park, Red Banks, Marianna, Galena, Watson, Gilton and Victoria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
